## ARCI

`arci` is an R package to create Anderson-Rubin confidence intervals for
instrumental variable regression models.

The function is compatible with models created with the `feols` function
from the `fixest` package.

The Anderson-Rubin method is robust to weak instruments and provides
valid inference even when the instruments are not strongly correlated
with the endogenous regressors.

To use it, please read the vignette under “Articles”. For more technical
background, check my blog post
[here](https://bas-m.netlify.app/posts/andersonrubin).

# Package index

## All functions

- [`ar_ci()`](https://basm92.github.io/arci/reference/ar_ci.md) :
  Calculate Anderson-Rubin Confidence Intervals for fixest IV objects
  (Compatible with Fixed Effects)
- [`get_ar_ci()`](https://basm92.github.io/arci/reference/get_ar_ci.md)
  : For a regression table, get Anderson-Rubin Confidence Intervals for
  fixest IV objects (Compatible with Fixed Effects)
- [`plot(`*`<ar_ci>`*`)`](https://basm92.github.io/arci/reference/plot.ar_ci.md)
  : Plot method for ar_ci objects
- [`print(`*`<ar_ci>`*`)`](https://basm92.github.io/arci/reference/print.ar_ci.md)
  : Print method for ar_ci objects

# Articles

### All vignettes

- [Anderson-Rubin Confidence Intervals based on \`feols\` IV regression
  objects](https://basm92.github.io/arci/articles/vignette-arci.md):
